Package pl.edu.pwr.student.IO.Output

Interface SignalReceiver

All Superinterfaces:
CreatableInstance
All Known Implementing Classes:
AND, BasicGate, BasicPassThrough, BasicReceiver, DebugLED, DebugPrinter, Delay, LED, NAND, NOR, NOT, OR, Speaker, VirtualIO, XNOR, XOR
public interface SignalReceiver extends CreatableInstance
Interface for a signal receiver which can connect to a SignalSender and receive updates.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    attemptConnect(SignalSender sender)
    Attempts to connect the signal receiver to a given SignalSender.
    boolean
    attemptDisconnect(SignalSender sender)
    Attempts to disconnect the signal receiver from a given SignalSender.
    void
    disconnectInputs()
    Disconnects all inputs of the signal receiver.
    void
    fullDisconnect()
    Fully disconnects the signal receiver from all inputs and outputs.
    boolean
    getState()
    Gets the current state of the signal receiver.
    void
    update()
    Updates the state of the signal receiver based on its input(s).

    Methods inherited from interface pl.edu.pwr.student.Gates.CreatableInstance

    getNewInstance

  • Method Details

    • getState

      boolean getState()
      Gets the current state of the signal receiver.
      Returns:
      the current state of the signal receiver

    • update

      void update()
      Updates the state of the signal receiver based on its input(s).

    • attemptConnect

      boolean attemptConnect(SignalSender sender)
      Attempts to connect the signal receiver to a given SignalSender. Should not be called manually - will not complete anything and return false.
      Parameters:
      sender - the SignalSender to connect to
      Returns:
      true if the connection was successful, false otherwise

    • attemptDisconnect

      boolean attemptDisconnect(SignalSender sender)
      Attempts to disconnect the signal receiver from a given SignalSender. Should not be called manually - will not complete anything and return false.
      Parameters:
      sender - the SignalSender to disconnect from
      Returns:
      true if the disconnection was successful, false otherwise

    • disconnectInputs

      void disconnectInputs()
      Disconnects all inputs of the signal receiver.

    • fullDisconnect

      void fullDisconnect()
      Fully disconnects the signal receiver from all inputs and outputs. Necessary to completely remove a gate from simulation and allow it to be collected by the garbage collector.
